reviews.text: The hotel is in need of upgrading if it wants returning customers. Rooms quite basic although they are palatial in comparison to surrounding villages and homes. Some staff are very good and attentive. On my visit I found the service slow. on the first occassion we ordered lunch and had to wait almost an hour to be served, this was probably due to a large group from ANZ bank who had a buffet organised. The second was poor service and a long wait for dinner because a group of travel agents had decided to stay at the hotel. Their dinner was served with enthusiasm whereas our group were small and had been there for three nights. We would not eat at the same hotel 4 nights in succession had there been anywhere else to go, so they had a captive audience so to speak. One night we fancied choosing a pizza, but were told that they had ran out of cheese, quite strange when they were giving out Pizza menus cards, if i was suspicious I would suggest it was due to pizzas being half the price of their other main meals !!! The resort taxis are very unrelaible, we had an occassion where we were waiting 2 hours on the resort van coming for us, it was taking the "its Fiji Time" to extreme, particularly when we had called the hotel 2 times and was assued it would be with us shortly, in the Fiji humidity this was probably not the best thing to say for customer service. the offer of a free drink was accepted but later we got a soft dring"on the house" I suppose they suspected I would choose an expensive cocktail if asked,
reviews.title: Some good points and some bad

reviews.text: We stay here for a week on our holiday after having stay at amunuca resort (which was wonderful) and when we arrive having booked for 2 adults and 2 children in a mountain view room we were shown to a room with 1 queen bed, we had to go and ask for extra bed for our children where they brought a cot and a single. Then we wanted to town and the hotel taxi charged us twice what the local taxi drivers charge from Loutoka. The walk down the hill to the restraurant was very difficult with little one and if you wanted to get a ride up or down you had to wait at least 1/2 an hour or more for someone to come and get you. The continental breakfast included in the room was alright but the rest of the food was disgusting it was cheap and it would also give you food poisoning my husband ordered a steak one night which was rancid and we ordered our son a pizza on an other night and the cheese was bad on it. The pool was clean and the view was nice as well as the population of mosquitoes there is no beach only mangroves and on the other side3 of the resort the mud flats are covered in rubbish and the ocean is so disgusting and grimy you wouldn't want to swim in it. The resort offer no real activities except their trip to beach comber island. The photos on the web site make it look really nice but the room we stayed in looked nothing like any of the photos on their page. The staff were friendly but i wouldn't recommend staying there for anyone.
reviews.title: The worst place on our holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thoroughly enjoyable 8 night stay. Met some wonderful people. Rooms spacious and clean. We were staying at the mountain view rooms and the walk to and from breakfast in the morning was refreshing. Staff always willing to transport guests in cars if they couldn't make the hill! Very good exercise. The staff were all exceptionally pleasant and always joking and laughing. The food was very good and plenty of choice. Didn't read any reviews before we left, as we prefer to make our own judgment rather than rely on what others think. The cane train passing through the grounds was quite magical. Cannot comprehend why some guests find it unacceptable. No pleasing everyone. Would most definitely return to the Anchorage. Thanks guys for a memorable time. Sue and Keith Clement October 2010 - Kerikeri New Zealand
reviews.title: More than we could have expected for the price paid - great place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Absolutely DO NOT stay here, we had all our cash and mobiles phones stolen whilst at breakfast, it is NOT worth the cheap rates. We were in transit to Octopus Island and had to stop over one night due to connections so thought we would stay somewhere near the marina, an awful start to the holiday as they knew we were booked on next boat out so couldnt make police report. After notifying management they offered no compensation whatsoever. hopeless, in fact a crime.
reviews.title: CASH & MOBILE PHONES STOLEN FROM ROOMS BU HOUSEKEEPING

reviews.text: What an amazing trip and great experience being my first visit to Fiji.
reviews.title: Absolutely amazingly fantastic time, Definitely will be back !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for a few nights as part of a bigger tour of Fiji for our honeymoon. We stayed in an oceanfront spa room which are the closest to the restaurant/bar and swimming pool. We checked in quite late as our flight arrived late from Sydney but the reception staff were very friendly and gave us our key, remote control for the TV and one for the aircon too. We've never stayed in a hotel before that did this so maybe they go missing from the rooms a lot. The first thing I noticed was the TV remote which was really shabby and covered in tape to hold it together.
reviews.title: Potentially great, wonderful staff but terrible owner!

reviews.text: As our room was a fair walk down the hill from the reception, they arranged to take us and our luggage down in a van. As it was late and there was no other staff available, the manager of the resort drove us down and showed us to our room. The room was actually very nice, with a nice spa bath and separate shower. The bed was a good size and a nice touch was that someone had spelt 'Welcome' in fresh leaves on the bed sheet!
reviews.title: The staff were wonderful; we requested the ocean view spa which was just fantastic.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now some things I didn't like about the room (that took me a while to notice):
reviews.title: Exactly what we expected!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1) The TV only has a couple of working channels, and both of those are pretty bad quality. Obviously you dont come to Fiji to watch TV but sometimes you just want to relax after dinner.
reviews.title: TAKING LIFE IN YOUR OWN HANDS DIRTIEST FILTHY PLACE WITH THE RUDEST STAFF & OWNER

reviews.text: 2) The shower was clean on first inspection but the grouting was actually very dirty especially around the door rollers.
reviews.title: survivor anchorage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The on line adverts portray a hotel of absolute quality that is a misnomer..whilst the location and views are just great. The Owner is best described as a drunken lout each evening he is at the bar, causing obvious embarrassment to his staff, a woman we presume to be his wife was also rude to the staff, in all very disturbing behavior.
reviews.title: THE MASTERN IS A MONSTER

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Other guests commented on the overall performance of this rude and crude duo.
reviews.title: WORST HOTEL
Actually not so bad... the price WAS right
reviews.text: We certainly will avoid the place .

reviews.title: Poor location, poor rooms, nice pool but that's about it.
reviews.text: We stayed for one week from 18th-25th July paying $3000AUS which was the worst money we've ever spent. The staff were unfriendly, unhelpful and quite rude often ignoring us as well as service being very slow.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't have hot water for 3 days for which we were told "the other rooms must have used it" which naturally, annoyed us more. We had paid for full board - VERY disappointing. The breakfast was poor - cereal, fruit and toast, and lunch and dinner very limited. Our one saving grace was our room - we stayed in a ocean view villa, which was nicely decorated and relatively clean.
reviews.title: another awesome stay

reviews.text: It's in a reclusive area unless you rent a car it's going to cost you a lot of money in taxi's.We booked the ocean view and they gave us the mountain view,when we told reception they changed our room but they were not happy about it.When we went down to the pool the place was empty,nothing to do,no activities,food and alcohol was over priced,we had continental breakfast included and all they had was toast (toaster was broken)some cerial and a bit of fruit.the stuff are not helpful in any way,i found them arrogant,the rooms were never washed just the beds done with the same linen and swept lightly and put fresh towels everyday.I wanted to leave the next day but already paid.There is no repairs done to the place,the tv never worked and the remote was missing called reception and as usual the repairer is on his way.My recomendation is not to go there spend a bit more money and go somewere else like denarau island
reviews.title: Boring place to stay

reviews.text: We booked in through the net from NZ and upon arrival there they couldnt find our reservation nn told us to fill in the forms again....and we didnt expected that as we had done all the paper work through the net...we had to wait in the reception area for 30minutes for them to organise our room....upon arrival in the room we found that the AC or neither the fan was in a working condition......when we tried to ring the reception the phone wasnt in a working condition....and their reception area was situated at the top of a hill....after about 45mins someone comes to fix the Ac n the fan. In th eevening we find out that the TV isnt in a working condition....what else can u expect when u pay so much for a nites stay...we complained but noone comes up......very bad experience overroll
reviews.title: Not Worth It

reviews.text: Sharma
reviews.title: Do your homework on this place

reviews.text: Wellington
reviews.title: Don't bag the Anchorage - it's OK!

reviews.text: NZ
reviews.title: gorgeous views and relaxing atmosphere
